availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Parker B. Bryant (Lexington, Kentucky, farmer and pig semen seller)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer. Jessamine County, Kentucky, native. Son of Benjamin Bryant and Dorcus Bryant. Married to Martha “Mattie” L. Nutter Bryant in Fayette County, Kentucky, on November 14, 1854. Father of Charles Bryant, Mary “Mattie” Bryant, Annie Bryant, Elizabeth Bryant, and Margaret Bryant. Farmer in Jessamine County in 1850. Household owned thirteen enslaved persons in Jessamine County in 1850. Farmer in Fayette County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860. Owned Lennie in Fayette County in 1865.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 437A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 4, p. 101A.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, p. 188.
